alert.note: Alert for Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 27 at 12:52PM EST until January 27 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama, including the following county, Geneva and Panhandle Florida, including the following county, Walton. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1152 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Samson, Eglin Air Force Base, Liberty, Paxton, Gaskin, Caney Creek, Lakewood, Hacoda, Gordon, Cluster Springs, Ganer, New Harmony, Flowersville, Earlytown, Fox Hill, Logan Field Municipal A/P, Pera, Weeks, Lowery and Sellersville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
